intro: Chamaecrista crommyotricha, commonly known as the yellow crownbeard, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual or biennial herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its seeds are enclosed in small, hairy pods, and the plant is often found in disturbed soils and open habitats. Chamaecrista crommyotricha is also known for its ability to fix nitrogen, contributing to soil fertility.
